when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings.
example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！ (arigatou, tetsudatte kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used to greet someone in the morning.
example: おはよう、元気？ (ohayou, genki?) - Good morning, how are you?

when_to_say: Used when parting ways for a long time.
example: 友達にさようならを言った。(Tomodachi ni sayounara wo itta.) - I said goodbye to my friend.

when_to_say: Used to apologize or get someone's attention politely.
example: すみません、道を教えていただけますか？(Sumimasen, michi wo oshiete itadakemasu ka?) - Excuse me, can you tell me the way?

when_to_say: Said before starting a meal.
example: いただきます！(Itadakimasu!) - Thank you for the food!

when_to_say: Used to express the act of eating.
example: 朝ご飯を食べる。(Asagohan wo taberu.) - I eat breakfast.

when_to_say: Used when talking about drinking.
example: 水を飲む。(Mizu wo nomu.) - I drink water.

when_to_say: Used to express running activities.
example: 公園で走る。(Kouen de hashiru.) - I run in the park.

when_to_say: Used when observing or looking at something.
example: 映画を見る。(Eiga wo miru.) - I watch a movie.

when_to_say: Used when referring to reading.
example: 本を読む。(Hon wo yomu.) - I read a book.

when_to_say: Used when talking about a companion or friend.
example: 友達と遊びます。(Tomodachi to asobimasu.) - I play with my friend.

when_to_say: Used when referring to a place of education.
example: 学校へ行きます。(Gakkou e ikimasu.) - I go to school.

when_to_say: Used to address or talk about a teacher.
example: 先生に質問します。(Sensei ni shitsumon shimasu.) - I ask the teacher a question.

when_to_say: Used to refer to studying or learning.
example: 日本語を勉強します。(Nihongo wo benkyou shimasu.) - I study Japanese.

when_to_say: Used to talk about a book or books.
example: 新しい本を買います。(Atarashii hon wo kaimasu.) - I buy a new book.

when_to_say: Used to describe a calm or silent environment.
example: 静かな部屋です。(Shizuka na heya desu.) - It's a quiet room.

when_to_say: Used to describe something moving quickly.
example: 速い車ですね。(Hayai kuruma desu ne.) - That's a fast car.

when_to_say: Used to describe something large in size.
example: 大きい家があります。(Ookii ie ga arimasu.) - There is a big house.

when_to_say: Used to describe warm or hot weather.
example: 今日は暑いです。(Kyou wa atsui desu.) - It's hot today.

when_to_say: Used to describe tasty food or drink.
example: 美味しいケーキですね。(Oishii keeki desu ne.) - This cake is delicious.

when_to_say: Used to talk about a pet or animal.
example: 私の犬はかわいいです。(Watashi no inu wa kawaii desu.) - My dog is cute.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a cat.
example: 猫が好きです。(Neko ga suki desu.) - I like cats.

when_to_say: Used when talking about birds.
example: 鳥が空を飛んでいます。(Tori ga sora wo tondeimasu.) - The bird is flying in the sky.

when_to_say: Used to refer to fish as an animal or food.
example: 魚を食べます。(Sakana wo tabemasu.) - I eat fish.

when_to_say: Used when talking about elephants.
example: 象は大きい動物です。(Zou wa ookii doubutsu desu.) - Elephants are large animals.

when_to_say: Used to describe the action of running.
example: 私は毎朝走ります。(Watashi wa mai asa hashirimasu.) - I run every morning.

when_to_say: Used to describe the act of swimming.
example: 彼はプールで泳ぎます。(Kare wa puuru de oyogimasu.) - He swims in the pool.

when_to_say: Used to describe the action of walking.
example: 毎日学校へ歩きます。(Mainichi gakkou e arukimasu.) - I walk to school every day.

when_to_say: Used when describing the act of jumping.
example: 彼は高く跳びます。(Kare wa takaku tobimasu.) - He jumps high.

when_to_say: Used to describe climbing a mountain or stairs.
example: 山を登ります。(Yama wo noborimasu.) - I climb the mountain.

when_to_say: Used to describe high cost or height.
example: この店は高いです。(Kono mise wa takai desu.) - This store is expensive.

when_to_say: Used to describe cold weather.
example: 今日は寒いです。(Kyou wa samui desu.) - It’s cold today.

when_to_say: Used to describe something fresh or new.
example: 新しい車を買いました。(Atarashii kuruma wo kaimashita.) - I bought a new car.

when_to_say: Used to describe something old or outdated.
example: 古い家に住んでいます。(Furui ie ni sundeimasu.) - I live in an old house.

when_to_say: Used to describe something fun or intriguing.
example: この本は面白いです。(Kono hon wa omoshiroi desu.) - This book is interesting.

when_to_say: Used to describe something small in size.
example: 小さい猫がいます。(Chiisai neko ga imasu.) - There is a small cat.

when_to_say: Used to describe someone or something as gentle or kind.
example: 彼女は優しい人です。(Kanojo wa yasashii hito desu.) - She is a kind person.

when_to_say: Used to describe something happening early or quickly.
example: 今日は早く起きました。(Kyou wa hayaku okimashita.) - I woke up early today.

when_to_say: Used to describe something as fun or pleasant.
example: 旅行はとても楽しかったです。(Ryokou wa totemo tanoshikatta desu.) - The trip was very fun.

when_to_say: Used to describe physical or mental strength.
example: 彼はとても強いです。(Kare wa totemo tsuyoi desu.) - He is very strong.

when_to_say: Used to describe a calm or quiet environment.
example: 図書館は静かです。(Toshokan wa shizuka desu.) - The library is quiet.

when_to_say: Used to describe something useful or handy.
example: このアプリは便利です。(Kono apuri wa benri desu.) - This app is convenient.

when_to_say: Used to describe warm weather.
example: 今日はとても暑いです。(Kyou wa totemo atsui desu.) - It's very hot today.

when_to_say: Used to describe something challenging.
example: 数学は難しいです。(Suugaku wa muzukashii desu.) - Math is difficult.

when_to_say: Used to describe a large or wide space.
example: この部屋は広いです。(Kono heya wa hiroi desu.) - This room is spacious.

when_to_say: Used to describe weight.
example: この荷物は重いです。(Kono nimotsu wa omoi desu.) - This luggage is heavy.

when_to_say: Used to describe physical proximity.
example: 駅は近いです。(Eki wa chikai desu.) - The station is nearby.

when_to_say: Used to describe slowness or tardiness.
example: 電車が遅いです。(Densha ga osoi desu.) - The train is slow.

when_to_say: Used to describe physical or emotional strength.
example: 彼は精神的に強いです。(Kare wa seishinteki ni tsuyoi desu.) - He is mentally strong.

when_to_say: Used to describe something as straightforward or simple.
example: このゲームは簡単です。(Kono geemu wa kantan desu.) - This game is easy.
